column2: TEXAS DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
2. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
3. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 4. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 5. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column6: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: always sound their horn and stay alert.

column2: 6. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
7. This sign means:
column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
10. A flashing yellow light means:
11. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 12. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
13. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
14. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column8: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 15. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
16. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
17. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column10: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 18. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column8: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 19. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column6: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column8: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column10: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.

column2: 20. A yellow arrow means:
column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.

column2: 21. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column10: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 22. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 23. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 24. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column10: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 25. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column2: 26. BAC is:
column4: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
28. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 29. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column8: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column10: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 30. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column6: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column8: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column10: go through as soon as the first train passes.
